data.author: Aristotle
data.quote: Education is the best provision for old age.

data.author: William Butler Yeats
data.quote: Do not wait to strike 'til the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.

data.author: The Holy Bible: Romans, 13:12
data.quote: The night is far spent, the day is at hand; let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.

data.author: Virgil
data.quote: How happy are those whose walls already rise!

data.author: Benjamin Franklin
data.quote: There never was a good knife made of bad steel.

data.author: George S. Patton
data.quote: Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.

data.author: Edward Gibbon
data.quote: The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.

data.author: Socrates
data.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.

data.author: St. Thomas Aquinas
data.quote: Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do.

data.author: Kahlil Gibran
data.quote: We only live to discover beauty. All else is a form of waiting.

data.author: John Lubbock
data.quote: Most of us can, ad we choose, make of the world either a palace or a prison.

data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
data.quote: Every genuine work of art has as much reason for being as the earth and the sun.

data.author: Socrates
data.quote: The ancient Oracle said that I was the wisest of all the Greeks. It is because I alone, of all the Greeks, know that I know nothing.

data.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
data.quote: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.

data.author: Australian Aboriginal saying
data.quote: Those who lose dreaming are lost.

data.author: Kofi Annan
data.quote: More than ever before in human history, we share a common destiny. We can master it only if we face it together. And that is why we have the United Nations.

data.author: Carl Sagan
data.quote: The brain is like a muscle. When it is in use we feel very good. Understanding is joyous.

data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
data.quote: The true test of civilization is, not the census, nor the size of cities, nor the crops - no, but the kind of man the country turns out.

data.author: Sophocles
data.quote: Numberless are the world's wonders, but none more wonderful than man.

data.author: Richard Branson
data.quote: Business opportunities are like buses, there’s always another one coming.
